_comment: Created by EFisher on 26/03/2014 16:55:44 using v2.1
title: How has the proportion of Category A (Red 1 & 2) calls attended within 8 minutes changed?
analysis_commentary:
Category A (Red 1 and Red 2) ambulance calls are those that are classed as life threatening and the national standard (A8) sets out that 75% of these calls should receive a response within eight minutes. This standard has not been reached in the last few months of 2013.

Between April 2011 and December 2013 there were ten months where this standard was breached nationally, which translates into a breach one month out of three. The frequency of breaches is also increasing year on year. In 2011/12 there were only two breaches, in 2012/13 there were three breaches and so far in 2013/14 this has increased to five breaches. In 2011/12 and 2012/13, the breaches mainly occurred during the December to March period, however, in 2013/14 the breaches first occurred during July 2013 (74%), after which it slightly recovered in August 2013 (75%) , before being breached again in September 2013 and continuing to decrease to 72% in December 2013.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
